subject: Re: [junit] Disabling Inherited Tests
msgSnippet: David, Great Tip!  Thanks. Well - In this case I m creating a whole bunch of connections to ApacheDS and then running tests. The JNDI connections are fairly
messageBody:
David,

Great Tip! Thanks.

Well - In this case
I'm creating a whole bunch
of connections to ApacheDS
and then running tests.

The JNDI connections are fairly
expensive, so when running the build
in Maven it takes a while...

Thanks again for the tip. It's a keeper.

- Ole



David Jackman wrote:
>
>
> Move the setup tests to a separate subclass (so the base class has only
> the setup). Is it really bad to test the setup whenever it gets
> invoked, though?
>
> ..David..

> I've created
> a SetupTest class
> that just performs setup,
> but also tests the setup.
>
> So when other test
> classes inherit from it,
> the inherited tests run
